aria-allowed-role-1.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
aria-allowed-role-1.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

items.snippet: <input type="checkbox" id="main-menu-input" class="toggle-list__checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false" aria-labelledby="mw-mf-main-menu-button">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

color-contrast-2.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
color-contrast-2.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 3.81 (foreground color: #72777d, background color: #eaecf0, font size: 10.5pt (14px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

link-name-3.title: Links do not have a discernible name
link-name-3.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn how to make links accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-name).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Element is in tab order and does not have accessible text

Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have text that is visible to screen readers
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute

target-size-4.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
target-size-4.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (198.3px by 21px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 21px instead of at least 24px.
